days.overview: Solomon declares the fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and instruction. True wisdom starts with proper reverence for God.
days.reflection: What does fearing the Lord mean? How is it the foundation of wisdom? What makes someone a fool?
days.prayer: Ask God for a healthy fear of Him that leads to true wisdom.

days.overview: Trust in the Lord with all your heart; don't lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him, and He will make straight your paths.
days.reflection: What does trusting God with all your heart mean? Where do you rely on your own understanding? How do you acknowledge God?
days.prayer: Commit to trusting God fully and acknowledging Him in all your ways.

days.overview: Above all else, guard your heart, for from it flow the springs of life. The heart is the wellspring of all we do.
days.reflection: What threatens your heart? How do you guard it? What flows from your heart?
days.prayer: Ask God to help you vigilantly guard your heart and keep it pure.

days.overview: Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall. Pride sets up inevitable collapse.
days.reflection: Where is pride showing up in your life? What destruction can pride cause? How do you cultivate humility?
days.prayer: Confess any pride and ask God to humble you before you fall.

days.overview: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; those who love it will eat its fruits. Words have tremendous power.
days.reflection: How have you used your tongue lately? What fruit have your words produced? How can you speak life?
days.prayer: Ask God to control your tongue and help you speak words of life.

days.overview: Iron sharpens iron, and one man sharpens another. Believers need mutual accountability and encouragement for spiritual growth.
days.reflection: Who sharpens you? Who are you sharpening? What does this sharpening look like?
days.prayer: Thank God for those who sharpen you and pray for wisdom to sharpen others.

days.overview: Charm is deceitful and beauty is vain, but a woman who fears the Lord is to be praised. Character matters more than appearance.
days.reflection: What do you valueâ€”outward beauty or inner character? How do you cultivate fear of the Lord? What is praiseworthy?
days.prayer: Ask God to help you value what He values and cultivate godly character.
